definition: to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])

sentences.english: Your smile is my life can not forget her.
sentences.chinese: 你的笑容，是我今生無法忘記的眷念。

sentences.english: Youth look forward and age backward.
sentences.chinese: 青年人展望未來，老年人眷念過去。

sentences.english: Love, can arouse all of the fondly.
Permanent change, the mind has a right to feel nostalgic autumn.
sentences.chinese: 永久不變的，心中多了一份對秋的眷念。

sentences.english: He finds his hometown greatly changed .
I'd been with her about two years, and my heart was really in her.
sentences.chinese: 我與這艘拖船已經相處兩年，對它充滿眷念。

definition: to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
to think of/to long for/to miss
to have a sentimental attachment to (a place)/to miss (one's ancestral home etc)/to be nostalgic about
reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
in love with/to feel deeply attached to
to recall with emotion/to feel sentiments
to worry about/to be concerned about
to be fondly attached to/to not wish to part with/to cling to
